title: Thunderbird incoming attachment opening issues
content:
Hi,

I recently received a PDF attachment from my customer but Thunderbird was not able to open it.

I had set Microsoft Edge to open PDF by default. I got this error message.

File not foundIt may have been moved, edited, or deleted. ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND

Whereas, if I saved the file to another location and I try to open it (again with MS Edge), there is no problem.

It seems having an "#" in the file name was part of the reason.

I could set Firefox to open the PDF by default but there seems to be disappearing fonts (in some instances) when I open a PDF with Firefox.

Not sure what to make of this but I am posting this here in case someone finds it useful.
creator: kanay.chellapa

title: Multiple email accounts and Address Book
content:
Hi Forum Folke,

I have three different email accounts that I use in Tbird. I had assumed that each account had a separate Address Book, but now that I'm migrating from one ISP to another (fiberoptic!), in preparing for the changeover, I realize that I seem to have only ONE address book that spans all three email accounts.

First: is this correct? Only one Address Book for any number of email accounts? And my main question: is there any way I can filter the Address Book by email account? I'm losing one account that came with my old ISP; those are the emails I want to create an email list for so I can do one mass-mailing to everyone using that email address to let them know what the new address is, and that this account will be disappearing.

I suppose I could just email everyone and put wording in there that 'IF you use such and such an account, it's going away and you need to use this address instead... but I have a number of vendor/business accounts, and they aren't going to care about that - - it's on ME to go to the account and change my email address. I'm frankly not sure which ones use the going-away account, and which don't; I was counting on Tbird to show me which was which... but it doesn't. Not as it stands at the moment, anyway.

Any ideas are very much appreciated; I'd rather avoid a mess because of this transfer!
creator: kharrisma

I have tried: Logging into the calendar with different Google Account details (I have 3 email addresses) Restarting my computer Updating computer Updating Thunderbird (there are no newer updates available) Looking for an option in the calendar to remember my login but there doesnt appear to be a setting for it Removing Thunderbird and related profiles Changing to a different calendar (Open Google Calendar / Google Calendar Plugin). All to no avail. Any ideas anyone?

Regards, barneybloggs

title: Thunderbird not recognizing login passwords
content:
I have Thunderbird 68.12.1 on two PCs and when I open Thundberbird on each, it repeatedly asks me for passwords for all 6 of my IMAP email accounts, even though the passwords are correct. None of the email accounts will log in, so I cant send or receive emails on either of my PC's. It just started doing this this morning, and is happening on both PCs. I have been using the same version Thunderbird to access these accounts for many years without a problem before today.

The error message I am getting is: "Login to server imap.dotster.com with username xxxx@xxxx.com failed" with 3 options "Retry" "Enter New Password" or "Cancel"

I can access the same IMAP email accounts using the same passwords using Aquamail on my Galaxy Phone without a problem. So I know the issue is with Thunderbird logging into the email server, and not the passwords or email server.

Help would be greatly appreciated as I use my PCs to send receive emails more than my phone.

title: Filters with multiple accounts
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for many years with two email accounts. I had them set to share an inbox, by having both accounts, plus the Local account, point to the same Local Directory on the Server Settings Page.

Until recently both of these accounts, while having distinct email addresses and distinct outbound mail servers, shared a single incoming mail server. I had it configured on both.

Normally I have focus set to the Local Inbox. I could use the global Get Messages button and it would fetch my mail.

Recently I reconfigured the mail servers. So now each account has its own incoming and outgoing servers.

Now, when I use the Get Messages button it only downloads from the first account. To explicitly download from the second account I must use the Get Messages popup on that account. Not ideal! After some searching I find that the global Get Messages only accesses the currently active account. But since I typically have the Local account active it must then just use the first non-local account. I want it to do them all.

I was looking for a solution. a discussion: "Unify your POP email accounts with a global inbox". I also find in Server Settings/Advanced: "When downloading from this account's server, use the following folder to store new messages / Inbox for different account".

These both seem to accomplish the same thing I'm currently doing differently. Will either or both of these get the effect I'm looking for?

I'm concerned about how any such change will affect which filters will be run. I have had separate, but identical, filters defined for each account, and also for the Local Account. (I don't know if the ones on the Local Account ever run.) Not ideal, but its what I got to work at the time I set it up. It would be ideal if I only had to maintain one set of filters.

I'm reluctant to start experimenting without first having a good idea what will happen because my email is very important to me.

title: Thunderbird Coder needed - to turn active account blocked by lost server to local account
content:
I have two mail accounts in Thunderbird that have permanently lost connection to their respective servers. I need to create permanent accessible offline archives of these emails.

Thunderbird cannot archive emails when the server connection is lost. I've tried a plugin export addin, doesn't work. The emails are there on my computer. But I can't access them through my normal profile.

Looking for someone who knows and can modify the basic behaviour of Thunderbird. The task is to modify those two accounts so that Thunderbird profile sees them as a local folder not a standard 'live' mailbox (where it constantly attempts to connect to server and won't allow access to the emails held offline).

The folders are there on my hard drive, but something needs to be done to the profile to recognise them as local folders rather than live accounts. i.e. working like a PST file in Outlook.

Happy to pay consultancy if this needs bespoke coding.
creator: charles119
